task.title: Setting Environment Variables
task.shortdesc: Use this information to find and set your environment variables. Set your system environment variables after all DITA Open Toolkit items are installed. The environment variables must be set for each item installed in this guide.

step.cmd: Modify each environmental or system variable.

chrow.choption: Set the PATH environment variable to include the directory where you installed the Ant bin directory.
Set the ANT_HOME environment variable to the directory where you installed Ant.
Set the JAVA_HOME environment variable to the directory where you installed the J2SE SDK application.
Set the JHHOME environment variable to the directory where you installed the JavaHelp application.
Set the CLASSPATH environment variable to include the .jar files from the Apache FOP application.

ol.li: set up your environment variable CLASSPATH to include the fop.jar, batik.jar and avalon.jar files in the FOP directory. For example: export CLASSPATH=${fop_dir}/build/fop.jar:${fop_dir}/lib/batik.jar:${fop_dir}/lib/avalon-framework-cvs-20020806.jar:${CLASSPATH}

chrow.choption: Set the CLASSPATH environment variable to include the directory where you installed Saxon.
chrow.chdesc:
If you use the Saxon,
Set up CLASSPATH to include the saxon.jar file. For example: export CLASSPATH=${CLASSPATH}:${saxon_dir}/saxon.jar
Set up ANT_OPTS. For example: export ANT_OPTS=${ANT_OPTS} -Djavax.xml.transform.TransformerFactory=com.icl.saxon.TransformerFactoryImpl

chrow.choption: Set the CLASSPATH environment variable to include the directory where you installed Xalan.
chrow.chdesc:
If you use the Xalan,
Set up CLASSPATH to include the xalan.jar file and the xercesImpl.jar file. For example:export CLASSPATH=${CLASSPATH}:${xalan_dir}/bin
